intro: [WRONG START] Hylotelelephium × furusei, commonly known as the Japanese stonecrop, is a hybrid succulent plant belonging to the Crassulaceae family. It is characterized by its fleshy, thick leaves that are typically blue-green in color, arranged in a rosette pattern. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink or red, typically in late summer. Native to East Asia, it thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its hardy nature and ornamental appeal make it a favored plant among gardeners seeking low-maintenance, drought-tolerant landscaping options.
